item.title: 美国联邦航空局调查工会声称波音公司在 2022 年对两名工程师实施报复的指控
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）周二表示，它正在调查一个工会提出的指控，即波音公司对两名员工进行报复，这两名员工在2022年坚持要求波音公司重新评估之前在777和787喷气式飞机上的工程工作。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration said Tuesday it is investigating claims by a union that Boeing retaliated against two employees who in 2022 insisted the planemaker re-evaluate prior engineering work on 777 and 787 jets.】

item.title: 贝克休斯季度利润因国际需求超出预期
item.description: 油田服务公司贝克休斯（Baker Hughes）第一季度利润超出分析师预期，原因是国际钻井需求增加。【原文：Oilfield services firm Baker Hughes beat analysts' estimates for first-quarter profit on higher international drilling demand.】

item.title: 精神公司与波音公司就改善航空供应商问题签署协议备忘录
item.description: Spirit AeroSystems 公司和波音公司签署了一份协议备忘录，以解决航空零部件供应商库存水平较高、合同资产和运营现金流较低等问题。【原文：Spirit AeroSystems and Boeing entered into a memorandum of agreement to address issues that include the aero parts supplier's higher levels of inventory, contract assets and lower operational cash flows.】

item.title: 工会主席称，UAW 在大众汽车组织工作获胜后迅速采取行动
item.description: 美国汽车工人联合会（UAW）主席肖恩-费恩（Shawn Fain）在田纳西州的一家大众汽车工厂取得历史性胜利后，正在迅速推进工会在美国十多家汽车制造商工厂的全面组织工作。【原文：United Auto Workers (UAW) President Shawn Fain is moving quickly in the union's sweeping organizing push at U.S. plants across more than a dozen automakers after clinching an historic victory at a Volkswagen plant in Tennessee.】

item.title: 玩具制造商美泰季度亏损低于预期，削减成本取得成效
item.description: 美泰公司（Mattel）周二公布的第一季度亏损额小于预期，这主要得益于芭比娃娃生产商对成本的严格控制，而玩具和游戏的需求仍然不温不火。【原文：Mattel posted a smaller-than-expected loss for the first quarter on Tuesday, helped by the Barbie maker's tight leash on costs while demand remains tepid for its toys and games.】

item.title: 模拟芯片制造商德州仪器预计季度营收高于预期
item.description: 周二，芯片制造商德州仪器公司（Texas Instruments）预计第二季度营收将高于华尔街预期，原因是消费电子产品需求在连续数月下降后有所改善，抵消了汽车市场芯片库存调整的影响有余。【原文：Chipmaker Texas Instruments forecast second-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, as consumer electronics demand improved after months of declines, more than offsetting the impact from chip inventory corrections in the automotive market.】

item.title: 消费者支出强劲，Visa 盈利增加
item.description: 本周二，Visa 公布第二季度利润增长，原因是消费者摆脱了对经济普遍放缓的担忧，继续在外出就餐和旅游方面消费。【原文：Visa reported a rise in its second-quarter profit on Tuesday, as consumers shrugged off worries of a broad economic slowdown and continued to spend on dining out and travel.】

item.title: 特斯拉季度收入自 2020 年以来首次下降
item.description: 由于需求放缓和全球竞争激烈，向客户交付的电动汽车数量减少，特斯拉第一季度收入下降。【原文：Tesla's revenue fell in the first quarter as it handed over fewer electric vehicles to customers due to slowing demand and intense competition worldwide.】

item.title: WeWork 创始人诺伊曼希望破产法庭帮助其回购公司
item.description: WeWork 创始人亚当-诺伊曼（Adam Neumann）周一表示，WeWork 管理层应参与谈判，否则将被迫放弃对公司重组的控制权。【原文：WeWork founder Adam Neumann has asked a U.S. bankruptcy judge to help his bid to re-acquire the coworking business, saying Monday that WeWork's management should engage in talks or be forced to cede control of the company's restructuring.】

item.title: 空中客车公司赢得加拿大对俄罗斯钛制裁的缓刑
item.description: 加拿大在乌克兰战争引发的最新一揽子措施中成为第一个禁止供应俄罗斯钛的西方国家政府，此后，加拿大给予空中客车公司豁免权，允许其在生产中使用俄罗斯钛。【原文：Canada has granted Airbus a waiver to allow it to use Russian titanium in its manufacturing after becoming the first Western government to ban supplies of the strategic metal in its latest package of measures triggered by the war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 独家报道电子邮件显示，美国国防承包商 L3Harris 将裁员 5%以节约成本
item.description: 路透社周二看到，美国国防承包商 L3Harris Technologies Inc 首席执行官克里斯-库巴西克（Chris Kubasik）在给员工的一封电子邮件中表示，作为节约成本措施的一部分，该公司今年将裁员 5%。【原文：U.S. defense contractor L3Harris Technologies Inc will cut 5% of its workforce this year as part of a cost saving measure, CEO Chris Kubasik said in an email to employees seen by Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 通知显示特斯拉将在加州裁员 3000 多人
item.description: 特斯拉将在加州裁员 3332 人，这家电动汽车制造商周一在多份工人调整和再培训通知（WARN）中表示。【原文：Tesla is set to cut 3,332 jobs in California, the electric-vehicle maker said in multiple Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification (WARN) notices on Monday.】

item.title: 报告称，人工智能热潮将在未来几年推动天然气需求增长
item.description: 投资银行家 Tudor Pickering Holt & Co 公司的分析师在周二的一份报告中说，人工智能（AI）数据中心用电量的激增可能会在本世纪下半叶大幅提高天然气需求。【原文：A spike in power usage from artificial intelligence (AI) data centers could significantly boost natural gas demand in the second half of the decade, analysts at investment banker Tudor Pickering Holt & Co said in a report on Tuesday.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：IBM 接近达成收购哈希公司的交易
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二报道，国际商业机器公司（International Business Machines）即将达成收购云软件供应商 HashiCorp 的交易。【原文：International Business Machines is nearing a deal to buy cloud software provider HashiCorp , the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 墨西哥年度总体通胀率在 4 月初有所上升
item.description: 路透社周二的一项民意调查显示，墨西哥4月上半月的总体通胀率可能有所上升，但核心通胀率有所放缓，这增强了人们对墨西哥央行将在下次货币政策会议上维持基准利率不变的预期。【原文：Mexican headline inflation likely ticked up in the first half of April as core inflation eased, a Reuters poll showed on Tuesday, boosting expectations that Mexico's central bank will hold its benchmark interest rate at its next monetary policy meeting.】

item.title: 彭博社报道：大银行在掉期和清算业务中面临 NDA 调查
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三报道，美国商品期货交易委员会（CFTC）已经联系了包括摩根大通、美国银行和花旗集团在内的多家银行，以了解它们是否一直在阻止潜在的举报人发表言论。【原文：The Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) has reached out to a number of banks, including JPMorgan Chase , Bank of America and Citigroup to see if they have been preventing would-be whistleblowers from speaking out, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，欧盟担心 KKR、意大利电信交易对批发业竞争的影响
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周二表示，欧盟反垄断监管机构正在询问竞争对手和客户，美国投资公司 KKR 收购意大利电信公司（TIM）固网接入网络的提议是否会阻碍意大利的批发市场。【原文：European Union antitrust regulators are asking rivals and customers whether proposed acquisition of Telecom Italia's (TIM) fixed-line access network by U.S. investment firm KKR could hamper Italy's wholesale market, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 阿根廷的米莱伊在财政赤字攻势中启动电锯和搅拌机
item.description: 阿根廷自由主义总统哈维尔-米莱伊正在加大对该国严重财政赤字的打击力度，加倍推行 "电锯式 "削减开支和 "搅拌式 "紧缩政策，以挤压购买力--他希望借此降低肆虐的通货膨胀。【原文：Argentina's libertarian President Javier Milei is revving up his attack on the country's deep fiscal deficit, doubling down on "chainsaw" spending cuts and "blender" austerity that squeezes purchasing power - and he hopes brings down rampant inflation.】

item.title: 摩根大通首席执行官戴蒙称美国经济蓬勃发展
item.description: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）表示，美国经济正在蓬勃发展，消费者支出继续保持弹性。【原文：JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon said the U.S. economy was booming and consumer spending continued to be resilient.】

item.title: 特斯拉推出高性能版 Model 3 紧凑型轿车
item.description: 特斯拉电动汽车公司网站周二显示，该公司在美国推出了 Model 3 紧凑型轿车的性能版，售价 52,990 美元。【原文：Tesla launched a performance variant of its Model 3 compact sedan in the United States at $52,990, the electric vehicle maker's website showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 由于中国需求低迷，Gucci 所有者 Kering 第一季度销售额下降 10
item.description: 法国奢侈品集团开云集团（Kering）周二公布的第一季度销售额下降了 10%，受其明星品牌古驰（Gucci）业绩放缓的拖累，古驰在进行全面设计的同时，也受到了亚洲市场疲软的影响。【原文：French luxury group Kering reported a 10% drop in first-quarter sales on Tuesday, dragged down by a slowdown at its star label Gucci, which suffered from weakness in Asia while undergoing a design overhaul.】

item.title: 通知显示特斯拉将在得克萨斯州工厂裁员近 2700 人
item.description: 特斯拉在一份工人调整和再培训通知（WARN）中表示，这家电动汽车制造商将在德克萨斯州工厂裁员 2688 人。【原文：Tesla will lay off 2,688 employees at its Texas factory, the electric vehicle maker said in a Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification (WARN) notice.】

item.title: UPS 在拖累联邦快递盈利的美国邮政服务工作中获利
item.description: 联合包裹服务公司（United Parcel Service）首席执行官卡罗尔-托梅（Carol Tome）周二表示，在竞争对手联邦快递（FedEx）苦苦挣扎于航空货运业务之后，该公司预计其新赢得的美国邮政（USPS）航空货运合同将在第一年和超过五年的合同期内实现盈利。【原文：United Parcel Service expects its newly won U.S. Postal Service (USPS) air cargo contract to be profitable in its first year and throughout the more than five-year deal, after rival FedEx struggled with the business, Chief Executive Carol Tome said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 智利电信公司 Entel 将 2024 年投资额提高至 6.18 亿美元
item.description: 智利电信公司 Entel 周二表示，该公司计划今年投资 6.18 亿美元，略高于 2023 年的支出计划。【原文：Chilean telecommunications firm Entel plans to invest $618 million this year, the company said on Tuesday, slightly above its 2023 spending.】

item.title: 美国 3 月新屋销售反弹
item.description: 3 月份美国新建独栋住宅的销售量较 2 月份下调后的水平有所反弹，这得益于市场上旧房持续短缺的支撑，但抵押贷款利率的回升可能会抑制这一势头。【原文：Sales of new U.S. single-family homes rebounded in March from February's downwardly revised level, drawing support from a persistent shortage of previously owned houses on the market, but momentum could be curbed by a resurgence in mortgage rates.】

item.title: 苹果公司称将于 5 月 7 日举行发布会
item.description: 苹果公司周二表示，该公司将于 5 月 7 日举行发布会，有报道称苹果将于下月推出期待已久的改版 iPad Pro 和 iPad Air。【原文：Apple will hold an event on May 7, the company said on Tuesday, amid reports that it would roll out the long-anticipated revamped versions of the iPad Pro and iPad Air next month.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，沃尔玛支持的金融科技公司 One 推出 "先买后付 "贷款
item.description: 据 CNBC 周二报道，沃尔玛控股的金融科技初创公司 One 已开始在该公司的一些美国零售店为电子产品和电动工具等大件商品提供 "先买后付"（BNPL）贷款。【原文：Walmart’s majority-owned fintech startup One has started offering buy now, pay later (BNPL) loans for big-ticket items like electronics and power tools at some of the retailer's U.S. stores, CNBC reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 提供 "风险资本 "投资机会的基金让投资者体验到了备忘录般的乐趣
item.description: 最近几周，一只允许股东投资私有科技公司的新基金让投资者大呼过瘾，同时也引起了晨星公司（Morningstar）和竞争对手方舟投资管理公司（ARK Investment Management）等机构的批评。 Destiny Tech100 的股价自 3 月 27 日推出以来上涨了约 200%，在此之前的三周内，该基金的股价跌宕起伏，自首次发行以来上涨了 1172%。【原文：A new fund that allows shareholders access to privately owned technology companies has sent investors on a wild ride in recent weeks while eliciting criticism from the likes of Morningstar and competitor ARK Investment Management. Shares of Destiny Tech100 are up some 200% since its March 27 launch, following a tumultuous three-week run that has seen it rise by as much as 1,172% from its debut pr】

item.title: 美国住宅建筑商 NVR 因住房供应紧张刺激销售，利润超出预期
item.description: 美国住宅建筑商 NVR 公司第一季度利润超出华尔街预期，原因是住房供应紧张推动了对新房的需求。【原文：U.S. homebuilder NVR Inc beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit as tight housing supply drove demand for new homes.】

item.title: 全球股票市场中性对冲基金大放异彩
item.description: 全球股票市场中性对冲基金吸引了投资者，因为在全球利率不确定和地缘政治紧张局势下，这些基金能比传统股票市场带来更好的回报。【原文：Global equity market-neutral hedge funds have lured investors as they can deliver better returns in times of global rates uncertainty and geopolitical tension than traditional stock markets.】
